top_categories.workout_context: 82ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Takelma Gravel Grinder's Oregon Cascades, Mountain gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 55 miles.
At Takelma Gravel Grinder, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Takelma Gravel Grinder. Train it until it feels boring.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Takelma Gravel Grinder's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
55 miles on Oregon Cascades gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Varied gradients on Oregon Cascades gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Takelma Gravel Grinder, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Smooth pedaling at 55 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
Base fitness for Takelma Gravel Grinder. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
When someone attacks on Oregon Cascades gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Takelma Gravel Grinder’s 55 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Takelma Gravel Grinder requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on oregon cascades gravel to build confidence. Expect: oregon cascades, mountain gravel, pacific northwest.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 55 miles of oregon cascades gravel in Canyonville, OR.
